\documentclass[11pt]{article}
\usepackage[a4paper,margin=1in]{geometry}
\usepackage{amsmath,amssymb}
\usepackage{hyperref}

\title{Information-Limited Gravity as a Pressure Display (Algebraic Equivalence)}
\author{Recognition Physics Institute}
\date{\today}

\begin{document}
\maketitle

\begin{abstract}
We rewrite the ILG effective source term, \(4\pi G a^2\,\rho\,w(k,a)\,\delta\),
using a pressure variable \(p:=\rho\,w\,\delta\), yielding the identical display
\(4\pi G a^2\,p\). This is a notational equivalence that preserves all ILG
identities (dimensionless kernel, rotation identities) and offers a pressure
language consistent with Russell's framing.
\end{abstract}

\section{Display}
Define \(p=\rho\,w\,\delta\). Then the Poisson source \(S=4\pi G a^2\rho w\delta\)
equals \(S=4\pi G a^2 p\). No new parameters are introduced and all kernel
properties carry through.

\end{document}
